title.narrative: WASH Response: Conflict Crisis in Tigray (HSU-0052)

description.narrative: The Tigray Crisis is an ongoing armed conflict that began around midnight of 3–4 November 2020 in the Tigray Region of Ethiopia. The conflict severely affected every sphere of people's lives. As a consequence of the fighting and violence, over fifty thousand refugees fled the country and nearly 1.7 million people have been displaced and are in desperate need of assistance, critical infrastructure has been destroyed. Within Tigray there are reportedly over 1.7 million people who are displaced and IDPs, and 5.2 million people require humanitarian assistance Over 561,000 people at new IDPs sites, returnee villages and urban centres across the region need support with water, health and sanitation (WASH) as existing WASH services have been damaged or are functioning due to lack of resources and the collapse of local administration.
